wikipedia_page.main: Samuel John Kydd (15 February 1915 – 26 March 1982) was a Northern Irish-born British actor. His best-known roles were in two major British television series of the 1960s, as the smuggler Orlando O'Connor in Crane and its sequel Orlando, and as a recurring character in Coronation Street. His first film was The Captive Heart (1946), where he played a POW. He made over 240 films, more than any other British actor, including 104 between 1946 and 1953 - playing a Police Inspector in ‘Trent’s Last Case’
